description.p: Clickonic.dll is a LiteStep Desktop module, that provides the ability to view folders on the desktop. Unlike the IconDesk, it is less customizable, but it completely supports drag-and-drop operations, so you can place your icons like YOU want...
Put Clickonic-1.1.5.dll in any directory you like, for example C:\LiteStep\, then add this line to step.rc
In the case you're using OTS2 compatible distro such as Omar's LiteStep Installer, AngelKnight's EZ2Install or Joshhh's Dist.ru, you should use the *NetLoadModule pseudo-operator:
Clickonic.dll can handle multiple icon groups, so first of all you need to instruct the module about groups' names. They will be used to configure and control the groups.

description.p: These settings effect all groups.
Note please, that each option begins from the group name, specified in the *Clickonic line.
Clickonic will export the following evars for each group.
Note, please, that the first parameter of each !bang command is a group name written in the *Clickonic line! If you forget to specify it, an error message will pop up.

These settings will cause Command to be fired upon certain events. Command can be any command or one of the following predefined actions: .none (does nothing), .rename (renames focused file), .delete (deletes selected files), .paste (pastes data in clipboard), .copy (copies selected files), .cut (cuts the selected files), .selectall (selects all files), .refresh (refreshes the folder view), .execute (runs the default action for all selected items), .changedir (changes the directory to the currently focused directory), .up (browses up 1 dir), .goup (moves the focus up one icon), .godown (moves the focus down one icon), .goleft (moves the focus left one icon), or .goright (moves the focus right one icon).

The mouse events support all the predefined actions of the regular events as well as .forward, .rectangle, and .systemmenu. .forward will forward the event to the desktop (xDesk, jDesk, desktop2, etc...). .rectangle will start the the selection rectangle (if the (group)RectangleModifierKeys are held down). .systemmenu will show the system menu (if the (group)SystemMenuModifierKeys are held down). While you can set the rectangle and and system menu to all mouse events, I would strongly recommend keeping them on a "ClickDown" event. Additionally, if you set a mouseevent to .changedir and hover your mouse over a directory, it will change to that directory instead of the currently focused directory.

If you are having problems with not being able to open .ZIP files, delete the "HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\SystemFileAssociations\.zip" key from the registry. If you want to undo this, create all necesary keys and set the default value of "HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\SystemFileAssociations\.zip\CLSID" to "{E88DCCE0-B7B3-11d1-A9F0-00AA0060FA31}".

If you are having problems with not being able to open the My Documents folder, change Attributes in HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\CLSID\{450D8FBA-AD25-11D0-98A8-0800361B1103}\ShellFolder from F080013D to B080013D
